About Javelin Global Commodities (“Javelin”)
Javelin Global Commodities is a leading global commodities marketing, trading, logistics services and investment firm with head offices in London and wider global offices in New York, Dallas, San Diego, St Louis, Canada, Switzerland, Poland, Dubai, India, Singapore, China and Australia. Javelin was founded in 2015 and now operates across six continents with respect to more than 20 different commodities across thermal coal, metallurgical coal, iron ore, steel scrap, metals, hydrocarbons, freight, agriculture, and renewables. 
Javelin employs over 200 people globally. We take pride in our values, global reach, meritocratic culture and strong work ethic. Our success over the years has been built on our guiding principles of customer service, creativity, transparency, integrity, and responsibility. Discover more at http://www.javelincommodities.com/.
About Javelin Private Capital Group (“JPCG”)
JPCG is the independent, full-service Investment Banking Advisory group of Javelin Global Commodities. JPCG provides investment banking services to support clients' business objectives including debt and equity capital raising, project finance and restructuring and capital structure advisory. Additionally, JPCG invests Javelin’s capital as part of the merchant banking services it offers clients.
As part of the Javelin Global Commodity platform JPCG is uniquely positioned to provide its clients bulge-bracket-scale investment banking resources and a global footprint, while maintaining a boutique investment bank-style of access to senior advisory professionals and highly tailored service offerings. Recent advisory assignments by senior bankers at JPCG include Puerto Rico PREPA solar development, Enviva, Jervois Global, Tacora Resources, Riverbed Technology, First Energy Solutions, Gladieux Metals Recycling and many others. 
The Role
JPCG is recruiting talented associates to join the New York office and to support our growing investment banking practice. Associates will directly support senior bankers and are expected to handle a high level of responsibility in the execution of regular financings, distressed financing and restructuring transactions. Associates work on small deal teams and have direct exposure to clients and senior bankers. Associates bear responsibility for providing the analysis underlying restructuring strategies, coordinating deal teams and developing junior bankers. Associates are expected to embrace a fast-paced environment, a high-level of responsibility and desire to grow their role in the team over time.

Plan, structure and execute corporate finance transactions in the public and private markets, advise clients on debt and equity raises, project financing, restructurings and recapitalizations 
Develop financial models, build cash flow projections and perform valuation analyses
Lead due diligence processes with the help of analyst colleagues
Oversee industry and company research and screenings
Prepare presentations and other materials for JPCG and its clients
Manage deal teams and analyst workstreams.

Exceptional attention to detail 
Ability to excel in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial work environment 
Undergraduate degree from a top-tier institution and stellar academic record
Prior experience working at a bulge-bracket, major or boutique investment bank is preferred (prior experience in restructuring, leveraged finance or debt capital markets is ideal)
Strong quantitative and financial statement analysis skills
Excellent communication skills (written and oral)
Strong knowledge of Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Bloomberg and other financial information tools (e.g., Capital IQ, etc.)

Practical training in valuation, M&A analysis, and financial strategy.
Mentorship and structured feedback from professionals with experience at top-tier investment firms.
A results-oriented environment that simulates real-world investment banking workflows.
Flexible working arrangements — remote opportunities available.

Aspiring investment bankers, finance enthusiasts, and high-agency individuals eager to gain elite experience before entering full-time analyst roles at investment banks and private equity firms.
